Comment: Could guess most answers, so barely learned anything.
A lot of variation and no givens, forcing you to read up on syntax. Had a trial period. I have used the site plenty on other subjects, must be new that it’s behind a paywall.
Did the introduction and day 1 to 3 in one sitting. It’s a lot of reading, and you have to come up with all the exercises yourself with very little inspiration.
Did the rest. It was mostly reading and some examples. The guide had links for other exercises/tutorials that might be useful.
Easy to follow how to set up a database using XAMPP, phpMyAdmin and PDO. Spend some Duration on connection errors that got solved by a reboot.
I want to turn this document into a web app. Thought about a database scheme. I Haven't implemented it yet.
Finished the tables and most of the forms to add data.
I am able to add all the data and display it all on tables on the index page. Considering what to do next.
Made a few queries for some stats.
Preparing for a job interview. A very long but good read about fundamentals.
Found a prep test for a certification exam. Did some of it as a warm up exercise.
Skimmed through some features to compare with the SQL that I’m familiar with.
Watched a video about multicast delegates and events in C# while taking a break.
Started on how to import this sheet. Turned out securities made it a bit more cumbersome than expected. I can select files in a folder and read them. I want to add an upload function as well.
Finished how to import. I changed the way I insert to the database and want to refactor the old way at some point.

Refactored for a better architecture. Added a classes to handle flow to the database, and begun to add controllers. I'm trying to go for a MVC structure, but it's mostly about to practise refactoring.
Added github and the rest of the controllers.
